intro: Hiraea obovata f. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular-leaved hiraea, is a variant of the hiraea plant characterized by its glandular features on the leaves and stems. This plant belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often hairy or glandular surfaces. The leaves are typically obovate, meaning they are broad at the tip and taper toward the base, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin.
